alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 9:42PM CDT until July 21 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northeastern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Southwestern Wilcox County in south central Alabama... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 942 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles south of Nellieburg to near Putnam to 7 miles south of Yellow Bluff, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Thomasville, Butler, Grove Hill, Whatley, Pine Hill, Lisman, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Fulton, Gilbertown, Yellow Bluff and Toxey. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
